title: LA-ICP-MS fission track dating
text: LA-ICP-MS FT single-grain age calculation using ‘zeta’ approach: \(t = \frac{1}{\lambda}~\ln \left(1+\frac{1}{2} \lambda \zeta_{icp} \frac{N_s}{A_s [ ^{238}U/^xX]} \right)\) single grain uncertainties: \(\frac{s[t]}{t} \approx \sqrt{ \left( \frac{s[\zeta_{icp}]}{\zeta_{icp}} \right) ^2 + \left( \frac{s[^{238}U/^xX]}{[^{238}U/^xX]} \right) ^2 + \frac{1}{N_s} }\) pooled age \(\overline{t} = \frac{1}{\lambda}~\ln \left( 1 + \frac{1}{2} \lambda \zeta_{icp} \frac{\sum N_s}{\sum A_s [^{238}U/^{x}X]} \right)\) Session ‘zeta’ given \(\zeta_{icp} = \frac{\left( e^{\lambda t} -1 \right) U   }{ \frac{1}{2} \lambda \rho_s}\) uncertainties \(\frac{s[\zeta_{icp}]}{\zeta_{icp}} = \sqrt{ \frac{1}{N_s} + \left( \frac{s[t]}{t}\right)^2 + \left(\frac{s[^{238}U/^{x}X]}{[^{238}U/^{x}X]}\right)^2}\)

title: LA-ICP-MS fission track dating
text: U [U content] given ratio 238U/43Ca based cps (apatite) U/Si (zircon). Therefor, rename columns.
code: library(readxl) library(dplyr)  library(laftr)  # load the U concentrations sample <- read_xlsx("../inst/extdata/example.xlsx", sheet = "sample") |>   rename(U = UCa, sU = sUCa)  # load the calibration measurements for zeta factor zeta.measurements <- read_xlsx("../inst/extdata/example.xlsx", sheet = "standard") |>   rename(U = UCa, sU = sUCa)

title: LA-ICP-MS fission track dating
text: zeta_ICP() giving calibration measurements used standard: returns list original data: … area, track densities, individual zetas: … final zeta factor (uncertainty)
code: session.zeta <- zeta_ICP(zeta.measurements, spotsize = 40, mineral = "apatite", standard = "Dur") head(session.zeta$data) |> as_tibble() ## # A tibble: 6 × 6 ##   Grain    Ns UO           U       sU comments ##   <chr> <dbl> <lgl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <lgl>    ## 1 DUR-1     4 NA    0.000496 0.000016 NA       ## 2 DUR-2     3 NA    0.00052  0.000018 NA       ## 3 DUR-3     1 NA    0.000476 0.000014 NA       ## 4 DUR-4     3 NA    0.000465 0.000014 NA       ## 5 DUR-5     6 NA    0.000471 0.000012 NA       ## 6 DUR-6     3 NA    0.000469 0.000014 NA head(session.zeta$results) |> as_tibble() ## # A tibble: 6 × 2 ##      rhos   zeta ##     <dbl>  <dbl> ## 1 318310. 0.0982 ## 2 238732. 0.137  ## 3  79577. 0.377  ## 4 238732. 0.123  ## 5 477465. 0.0622 ## 6 238732. 0.124 session.zeta$zeta |> as_tibble() ## # A tibble: 2 × 1 ##    value ##    <dbl> ## 1 0.118  ## 2 0.0118

title: LA-ICP-MS fission track dating
text: age_ICP() using just calculated zeta factor calibration returns list containing original dataset: .. individual ages: … pooled age sample: … chi-squared statistics:

title: LA-ICP-MS fission track dating
code: # library(IsoplotR) data.iso <- as.fissiontracks(sample, spotsize = 40, zeta = session.zeta$zeta) ages.iso <- as.fissiontracks(result$ages, ages = TRUE)

title: LA-ICP-MS fission track dating
text: using functions IsoplotR package (P. Vermeesch):  laftr function geom_aKDE() using adaptive KDE ggplot2:
code: IsoplotR::kde(ages.iso[, 1]) library(ggplot2)  data.frame(t = ages.iso[, 1], st = ages.iso[, 2]) |>   ggplot(aes(x = t, weight = t / st)) +   geom_aKDE(aes(y = after_stat(scaled)), fill = "steelblue", alpha = .75) +   geom_histogram(aes(y = after_stat(ncount)), color = "grey", fill = "grey", alpha = .5) + # weighted histogram   geom_rug(alpha = 0.5)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tobias Stephan. Author, maintainer. Taís Fontes Pinto. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Stephan T, Fontes Pinto T (2024). laftr: Calculates ages LA-ICP-MS based fission track dating. R package version 0.1.0, https://tobiste.github.io/laftr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {laftr: Calculates the ages from LA-ICP-MS based fission track dating},   author = {Tobias Stephan and Taís {Fontes Pinto}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://tobiste.github.io/laftr/}, }

what: Calculates the ages from LA-ICP-MS based fission track dating
title: Calculates the ages from LA-ICP-MS based fission track dating
text: laftr free open-source R package calculates ages LA-ICP-MS based fission track (LAFT) dating using zeta approach

title: Adaptive kernel density estimates — aKDE
text: Modification ggplot2::stat_density() kernel density estimates using combination Botev (2010) bandwidth selector Abramson (1982) adaptive kernel bandwidth modifier.

title: Adaptive kernel density estimates — aKDE
code: stat_aKDE(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "DensityAdaptive",   geom = "area",   position = "stack",   ...,   from = NA,   to = NA,   bw = NA,   adjust = 1,   kernel = "gaussian",   n = 512,   adaptive = TRUE,   na.rm = FALSE,   bounds = c(-Inf, Inf),   show.legend = NA,   orientation = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )  geom_aKDE(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "DensityAdaptive",   position = "identity",   ...,   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   outline.type = "upper" )

title: Adaptive kernel density estimates — aKDE
text: Algorithm adaptive kernel modified IsoplotR. algorithm optimal kernel bandwidth provenance::botev().

title: Adaptive kernel density estimates — aKDE
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). geom, stat Use override default connection geom_density() stat_density(). position Position adjustment, either string naming adjustment (e.g. "jitter" use position_jitter), result call position adjustment function. Use latter need change settings adjustment. ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. , left right-points grid density estimated bw bandwidth KDE. NULL, bw calculated automatically using algorithm Botev et al. (2010). adjust multiplicate bandwidth adjustment. makes possible adjust bandwidth still using bandwidth estimator. example, adjust = 1/2 means use half default bandwidth. kernel Kernel. See list available kernels density(). n number equally spaced points density estimated, power two, see density() details adaptive logical flag controlling adaptive KDE modifier Abramson (1982) used na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. bounds Known lower upper bounds estimated data. Default c(-Inf, Inf) means (finite) bounds. bound finite, boundary effect default density estimation corrected reflecting tails outside bounds around closest edge. Data points outside bounds removed warning. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. orientation orientation layer. default (NA) automatically determines orientation aesthetic mapping. rare event fails can given explicitly setting orientation either "x" "y". See Orientation section detail. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders(). outline.type Type outline area; "" draws upper lower lines, "upper"/"lower" draws respective lines . "full" draws closed polygon around area.

title: Adaptive kernel density estimates — aKDE
code: data("sample") example <- age_ICP(sample, zeta = c(0.1188, 0.0119)) # IsoplotR::kde(example$ages$t) ggplot2::ggplot(data = example$ages, mapping = ggplot2::aes(x = t)) +   stat_aKDE(adaptive = TRUE) +   stat_aKDE(adaptive = FALSE, color = "red", fill = NA) #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_density_adaptive()`). #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_density_adaptive()`).   ggplot2::ggplot( data = example$ages, mapping = ggplot2::aes(x = t, weight = t / st)) +   geom_aKDE(   ggplot2::aes(y = ggplot2::after_stat(scaled)),   kernel = "epanechnikov", fill = "steelblue", alpha = .75) +   ggplot2::geom_histogram(   ggplot2::aes(y = ggplot2::after_stat(ncount)),   color = "grey", fill = "grey", alpha = .5) +   ggplot2::geom_rug(alpha = 0.5) #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_density_adaptive()`). #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range (`stat_bin()`).

title: Absolute FT ages — age_ICP
text: Calculation ages LA-ICP-MS using zeta calibration

title: Absolute FT ages — age_ICP
text: x data.frame containing counts spontaneous tracks, U concentrations, uncertainties U concentrations spotsize laser ablation spot size (diameter micrometer) zeta two-element vector zeta-factor standard error. ... additional arguments

title: Absolute FT ages — age_ICP
text: list single grain ages analytical uncertainties, pooled age, chisq statistics

title: Absolute FT ages — age_ICP
text: fission track age using zeta calibration approach (Hasebe et al. 2009) given $$t = \frac{1}{\lambda} \ln \left(1+\frac{1}{2} \lambda \zeta_{icp} \frac{N)s}{A_s [ ^{238}U/^xX]} \right)$$ \(\lambda\) 238U decay constant, \(\zeta_{icp}\) zeta calibration factor, \(N_s\) count spontaneous fission tracks, \(A_s\) size ablated area, \([ ^{238}U/^xX]\) either stands \(^{238}\)U-concentration (ppm) U/Ca (apatite) U/Si (zircon) ratio measurement.

title: Absolute FT ages — age_ICP
text: Hasebe, N., Carter, ., Hurford, .J., Arai, S., 2009. effect chemical etching LA-ICP-MS analysis determining uranium concentration fission-track chronometry. Geol. Soc. Lond. Spec. Publ. 324 (1), 37--46. doi:10.1144/SP324.3 Vermeesch, Pieter, 2017. Statistics LA-ICP-MS based fission track dating. Chem. Geol. 456, 19--27. doi:10.1016/j.chemgeo.2017.03.002

title: Export to IsoplotR — as.fissiontracks

title: Export to IsoplotR — as.fissiontracks
text: x data.frame spontaneous fission track counts U-concentration spotsize laser ablation spot size zeta zeta calibration constant extracted input data ages logical. FALSE x represents unprocessed data (default), TRUE processed ages

title: Export to IsoplotR — as.fissiontracks
text: object class fissiontracks

text: t numeric. ages st numeric. analytical uncertainties na.rm logical. whether NA values removed (TRUE) (FALSE)
